reviewText: It's quite fashionalble to declare the sitcom is dead, and for a very good reason.  Pick any period in time, starting with the first sitcoms in the 50s and moving right on through to today, look at the total sitcom landscape, and puke.  And yet, once in a while, a real gem comes along.  Dick Van Dyke, Cosby (in its prime), Seinfeld, Are You Being Served?, Fawlty Towers, My Family.  It's simply brilliant.  Never forced, always funny, mostly realistic, driven by strong writing and excellent acting.  Oh yeah, and Nick's teeth.  With only 21 episodes, I blasted through this in 3 nights.  So now I'll just put it on my shelf next to a very small collection of DVDs that I'll watch again, and again, and again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A little off-beat but still consistently clever and witty with one-liners abounding.  This dysfunctional family has a disillusioned father and a towering highlight in son, Nick, whose brilliance in manifesting the  ridiculous, the bizarre, the unexpected and the unorthodox are supreme.  Otherwise, it's conventional, domestic UK family comedy set in suburbia, so if you're looking to extend your collection of comedy beyond the mainstream (like 'To The Manor Born' and 'Yes, Minister') then obtain this series for hours of laughs while getting to know this family.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This sitcom gives American audiences the opportunity to view this quirky family as the three children go through the teenage years.  The dynamics are interesting and entertaining; all the characters are more than one-dimentional. After viewing the series on BBC America for a couple of seasons (or whenever it was shown in the USA), I felt I wanted to buy the DVD's so that I could enjoy watching the episodes for years to come.

reviewText: This, in my opinion, is a hidden comedy that will have you laughing out loud.Unfortunately, like a lot of shows, it begins to lose steam, and the children begin to grow out of their cute phase. The best of the lot are the first two seasons. After that it's good, but not as...

reviewText: I first saw this show on BBC America and it is one of those funny English sitcoms that you can watch over and over again. This is a bare bones set (no extras) but has the most important part...the shows. If you're a fan of quirky English comedies then this one is for you, If fact I am impatiently waiting for BBC to release the other seasons of this show.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The only problem with My Family is that its run was way too short. British comedy is sometimes obscure and stuffy, but this is incisive, sparkling, endlessly hysterical. The dynamic between the cast members is brilliant, the writing terrific, and the timing and delivery nothing short of magic. Watch it NOW!!!
Title: N/A
